Reviews.Title: “The only place I'll stay in Rome”
Reviews.Author: travelerheart
Reviews.Content: My husband and I have been to Rome 3 times over many years and have stayed at the Cornet each time. We find it charming, interesting, and the location can't be beat. We are planning another trip for October with two friends and the Cornet will be where we stay. We have brought other friends the Cornet as well. When you have a great place you stay with it.

Reviews.Title: “Great location and clean”
Reviews.Author: TravelerSue42
Reviews.Content: This is a very nice budget hotel in the old fashioned European style. It reminded me of the little one star hotels where we would stay when we traveled over 20 years ago. The staff was friendly and helpful, spoke English and recommended a great restaurant. We had a very large room with bath, overlooking the beautiful courtyard. There were not many amenities so if you have to have a terry cloth towel, bring your own. The linen towels the hotel provided were very large and clean and sufficient. Of course the age of the building means it is care-worn, but I found the place charming. It is in a great location near the Pantheon and the Piazza Venizia. We walked everywhere from here. We were here in the off season and really enjoyed our stay. The place does not have central air conditioning, so I am not sure I would stay here in hot weather.

Reviews.Title: “Terribly overprized !”
Reviews.Author: mark112
Reviews.Content: For 190Euro we’ve got a run down room with broken glass window. No air-conditioner, no refrigerator, no safe in the room. Breakfast is bread, butter, cheese and coffee. Legally they can charge from 35 to192 euro per night. In case you are willing to stay in the cheap motel- like environment, my advise is to insist on the price of 45-50 euro

Reviews.Title: “great value if you don't need pampering”
Reviews.Author: Fleebus-the-Wanderer
Reviews.Content: My wife and I stayed in this hotel in December and found it to be an excellent value and location. We would definitely return here. Perhaps chosing the private bath option though. We picked the hotel based on reviews here. Staff: The staff was generally friendly, knowledgable and helpful. They let us store bags here for a few days trip to pompei Location: As many reviews state, the location is a bit noisy but is very safe. There is easy access by express bus to Termini station from nearby. There's about a 10 min walk to a good gelato place however. That's probably my most serious criticism. Noise: We had a room without bath on the exterior wall. The courtyard outside the hotel tended to cause noise out there to echo a bit. It did not disturb our rest however. If you are sensitive to the noise, contact the staff and make sure you're on an inner room. The staff was very easy to communicate with by email to straighten out details before the trip. If you are sensitive to noise, you may want to reconsider visiting Rome anyway. Scuzi! Cleanliness: The room was quite clean. The bathrooms were clean as well but were a bit on the musty side odor-wise. Bathrooms: There were 3 common baths all with Toilet and shower. I'm 6'2" and used the showers. It wasn't the most ergonomic experience of my life but it was ok. The baths are all different so you'll probably find one that is to your liking. There was no soap in the bathroom -- this baffles me. I tried to leave a soap there but for whatever reason it was gone the next night. If there's no soap, then no one washed their hands before touching the door knob. Bring soap and a tissue perhaps if you're sensitive to this. We washed out hands at the sink in the room after. Towels: Italian towels are like a nice Americal tablecloth. If you think you might have a problem with this, I recommend trying to dry yourself with a tablecloth at home before deciding to bring your own towel. It was fine for me. I might switch to tablecloths at home now! (they don't use the American Towel for the Italian Tablecloth in case you're wondering about that) Room: It was plenty big (14x 16 approx) there was a chair, a wardrobe, a bed, a sink. 12' ceilings approx. It wasn't decorated recently or perhaps even well. I couldn't care less about the decor. Who goes on vacation to complain about the decor of the hotel? I doubt those people can have a good time. Access: There is an elevator that is small and also a wide stairwell. There is a step up into the building from street level. I wouldn't recommend this hotel if you have a disability that limits your mobility in tight places. Food: Breakfast was fine. Nothing special but a good cheap start on your day. you can have as much juice and milk as you want. There are numerous cafes around to get better food and more coffee.

Reviews.Title: “Great value hotel in Rome”
Reviews.Author: sjsaville
Reviews.Content: I had a wonderful stay here with my 8 year old son. We had a room facing the courtyard and these are well worth paying the small extra for as they are quiet and have their own bathroom. The staff are kind and helpful. The breakfast is a feast compared to usual Italian fare. The hotel is very well situated for the sites. The rooms are quite grand in scale and although not offering the opulence of more expensive places it was very decent with comfy beds.

Reviews.Title: “Good room, good price, good location”
Reviews.Author: EyeMD
Reviews.Content: Pros: Got a decent size "triple" - king bed with pull out couch - with crib for family of 4. Plenty of room considering how tiny European hotels can be. Not too expensive. A hop away from the Pantheon. Close to some good resturaunts. I was able to walk everywhere I wanted to from the hotel (except for the Vatican) with 2 strollers. Friendly staff. Clean room every day. Private bathroom in this room (but not all rooms). Allowed us to keep our own food and baby bottles in the office fridge. Cons: Difficult to reserve - sent multiple emails without response . Finally I had to call it in - they said they'd email me a conformation. Never got it (didn't matter). Towles are like tablecloths. Breakfast is slim pickins. Set wake up call for 6am and received one promptly at 5am. Overall: Pros outweigh the cons. European small hotels can get creepy. This was nice, in a great location, and for a decent price. Tip: When you come out the door onto the street - careful, you're one the street; no sidewalk - look up and to the left onto the ledge fo the building across the way. You'll see why they call the street "Via Del Gatto."

Reviews.Title: “Loved the Coronet”
Reviews.Author: AjitKulkarni
Reviews.Content: The Coronet was a charming pensione. Our room was comfortable, very clean bathrooms and the staff was very friendly. The air-conditioner had to be drained off water every once in a while, but it was not a problem at all. The Coronet is in the midst of everything, you can pretty much walk to all the major attractions Rome has to offer. We went to the Pantheon at midnight and felt safe. I would definetely recommend the Coronet to the traveller who does not expect a "Sheraton" or "Hilton" like treatment. We were in Rome to explore the city and not spend time in our hotel. This Coronet was just perfect for us, in our budget, clean, comfortable and close to everything. The staff offered to look after our luggage on the day we checked out since we were leaving later that night. Will definetely stay there again. -Ajit

Reviews.Title: “the Coronet is charming”
Reviews.Author: nicski
Reviews.Content: We liked everything about the Coronet - it's in an ideal location and our large room looked over the quiet courtyard. There's a police station out front, so you always feel safe coming and going at all hours. The staff was especially helpful when we needed to call a friend whose mother could not understand my broken Italian. When we left, the front desk arranged for a towncar to take us to the airport - only 55 euro!

Reviews.Title: “Great location, friendly staff, great place for the price”
Reviews.Author: anony212
Reviews.Content: This was my first visit to Italy and we stayed at some pretty mediocre places in other cities. When we got to Rome, this hotel was a nice change. Honestly, when you're on vacation, how concerned should you be about TV and internet-- you should be out enjoying the city. So even though it doesn't have all the modern luxuries, it was a really nice place to come home to. The rooms are huge and everything is super clean so the oldness just gave it a bit of charm. The staff is super nice and helpful (gave us great recommendations for where to eat/party/sights to see), no rude attitudes at all which is more than I can say for a lot of places. As two single girls, it can be a little sketchy walking home alone at night, but this hotel is in a well-lit, safe location and there are police officers stationed right outside. Within walking distance of absolutely everything-- all the tourist sites and nightlife. Its not the 4 Seasons, but if you're looking for an affordable place to stay in a really great central location, this is it. I just recommended it to a friend going to Rome next month.

Reviews.Title: “Terrible”
Reviews.Author: Haywelch
Reviews.Content: It is filthy, We had ants all over the bathroom. The airconditioner didn;t work. We asked the desk clerk to book a taxi for us to the airport and he charged us 90E for it and wanted the money immediately and when we took the taxi the meter read under 25E.

Reviews.Title: “In defence of the Coronet...”
Reviews.Author: LadyLisaP
Reviews.Content: In response to some of the reviews on here I would like to defend the Coronet and give some useful advice instead of being totally negative. General Hotel: Like others have said needs a refurb (and a touch of the How not to Decorate people) but it is 2/3 * remember and to be honest you shouldn't be spending that much time in the room anyway. Staff: All staff were pleasant to us, and more importantly could speak English, which was enough for us as none of us spoke Italian. One guy with sideburns was particularly friendly. There is one oldish man who serves the breakfast and cleans the rooms, he does a good job and we were not kicked out of our room too early on New Year's Day - as we did not know that check out was at 1130 they let us go when we wanted (obviously wasn't that busy). Breakfast: A cup of tea and a big roll and cereals if you want it, the bread roll was enough to fill us up till lunchtime and after all you want to enjoy the food in Rome so maybe its no point bothering with breakfast? Other Facilities: Most European 2/3* hotels I have stayed in don't have tea and coffee facilities or tvs - not that you would be able to understand them and again as I said we didn't spend that much time in the room anyway. Towels - the 'linen sheets' are standard in a lot of Roman hotels, we met some guys who were staying in a 4* hotel and they had the same. The location of the hotel is the most postive thing about this hotel, but I can only deduce that some of the reviewers on here just had negative stays there - luck of the draw it has all happened to all of us - even me, but I would recommend this hotel to anyone, just remember the following: 1) It is a 2/3* hotel. 2) It is on the 3rd Floor of the building (this is a VERY important piece of information to note as we walked into someone's house on the ground floor and as you imagine she wasn't too happy... oops When you arrive - take the lift to the 3rd floor immediately! 3) Take a towel! If anyone wants info on Rome please email: ----- Have fun! LP.

Reviews.Title: “Disliked the Coronet Hotel”
Reviews.Author: Ronelle
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the Coronet for 3 nights and will definately not recommend this hotel to anybody. Firstly, the services information as advertised and posted on the internet is misstated. It states that the hotel offers an internet service, laundry service, 24 hour room service, lounge, TV room, shared kitchen facility, etc. When we enquired about these services, we were told that the hotel does not have an internet facility for guests and the closest internet service is down the road toward the Pantheon. The person at reception also did not know where the closest laundry service was. I did not see a lounge or TV room in the hotel, unless the small breakfast room with the small TV on a shelf is regarded as the lounge and/or TV room. I can't see how they can offer 24 hour room service if they do not have a restaurant or cafeteria on the premises. The shared kitchen is indeed not a shared kitcken as there is a large 'Private' sign on the door of the kitchen and the hotel breakfast is prepared in the same kitchen as well. The room (room 34) was in serious need of maintenance as the paint was peeling on the wall. What was also very interesting was the 'airconditioning'. This consisted of a free standing airconditioning unit of which the hot air outlet needed to be placed manually outside an open window. With the effect that hot air and noise filtered into the room. No towels were provided in the bathroom, but merely linen sheets (that reminded very much of table cloths) to dry ourselves. This was quite an interesting exercise, expecially taking into account the hot and cold water fluctuations in the hand-held shower. The breakfast was below standard and we went out for breakfast everyday. Taking into account the additional money spent on breakfast for the four of us, we could just as well have booked into a better hotel for the same cost. The only positive point about this hotel is its location.

Reviews.Title: “Excelent location”
Reviews.Author: AndraPiciu
Reviews.Content: In Rome it is usual to see old fashioned hotels, placed in old palaces.The location of hotel Coronet and the safety of the entire area recommend it strongly. The breakfast was enough, not only coffee as was described previously and it was clean.It is in the point zero of the heart of Rome, close to every major atraction, but not in the noise and problems of this city.

Reviews.Title: “worst hotel of my life”
Reviews.Author: janisc
Reviews.Content: We arrived at this hotel July 2004 Grandmother, daughter and grandaughter so a triple room. It was dark and dingy and we were truly frightened when we went in the huge doors and saw nothing but a dark dank hallway with stairs and a elevator, the kind you have to lift the cage door to open, right out or a murder movie in an abandonned building! We rode up to the 3rd floor in the eleavator, and still no desk or clerk just those stairs . There is an small door that is locked and you must ring the bell and a spooky old guy comes and lets you in (not that your sure you want to go in!) The reception area is as bad as it gets and he checks you in and the key is the skelton type that fits all doors! We baracated the door with a chair! The place was said to have A/C but it was very strange, you had to leave the window open to let it work and then it did not as the hot air came in. It was a white plastic unit on wheels! We were stifiling. The bathroom was a converted closet and the toilet ran all night long. We asked to leave the nest morning and they let us out of a 4 night reservation. We went to the Cesari and it was great. More money but past a point who cares!! oh the breakfast was terrible, just get out if you even go to the Coronet.

Reviews.Title: “Great Value for Money”
Reviews.Author: ClareK1980
Reviews.Content: I also arrived on 17th Nov - but had a very different experience to the previous reviewer. Myself and my friend shared a spacious twin room overlooking the quiet courtyard. The hotel/pension is old and basic, but paying only EUR80 per night for the room it was very good value for money. The location was superb, plenty of hot water, and it was clean. Breakfast is nothing special, but perfectly adequate for a 2-star hotel. With so much to do in Rome, if you rather spend your money going out and enjoying the retaurants, bars and sights rather than on a fancy hotel, the Coronet suits perfectly.

Reviews.Title: “Terrible experience”
Reviews.Author: pilota
Reviews.Content: Hotel Coronet in Rome was a most unpleasant experience. The bathroom was moldy, smelly, and breakfast was minimal. Beware

Reviews.Title: “Location good, needs a good scrub”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: The Hotel Coronet is centrally located, walking distance to the Pantheon, Spanish Steps, Trevi Fountain. Yes there are police in the Piazza outside the hotel, and we had no problems feeling safe walking around in the evening to dinner or to see the sights. Our issue, was the toilette had a nauseating odor, which we spoke with the front desk about and it was a bit better that evening when we returned, but it still had an odor which was not acceptable. The shower had black mold around and our room didn't seem that clean. At breakfast I asked for tea, I opened the pot to put my tea bag and the pot was dirty. These things are not acceptable to us when we travel. We have no problem with old but clean is a must.

Reviews.Title: “Great Location!”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: The Coronet was very centrally located for walking to all the major attractions and was in a safe neighborhood. The staff was friendly and helpful, the rooms were clean and neat (the courtyard view rooms have a nice view), the bed was comfortable. We were very happy with our stay.

Reviews.Title: “Good Value”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: An older hotel, the Coronet is a little worn around the edges, but it was clean and the staff was very friendly and very helpful, and we felt very safe. We occupied several rooms and a few had showers that did not drain well. This is a great place to stay for the value and it is centrally located to all the major sites. We walked everywhere except to the Vatican, but the bus line is less than a block away. Beware of the Rome pickpocketers. Always use a money pouch. Vicki Van Vliet

HotelInfo.Name: Hotel Coronet
HotelInfo.Address: Piazza Grazioli 5, 00186 Rome, Italy
